prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a curved top edge Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 degrees and the translation vector to 0.0, 0.0608, 0.0. Next, create the 2D sketch. On the first face, create a loop consisting of the following curves: * Arc 1 with a start point at [0.0, 0.1217], a mid point at [0.1217, 0.0], and an end point at [0.2433, 0.1217]. * Line 1 with a start point at [0.2433, 0.1217] and an end point at [0.2433, 0.6283]. * Arc 2 with a start point at [0.2433, 0.6283], a mid point at [0.1217, 0.5067], and an end point at [0.0, 0.6283]. * Line 2 with a start point at [0.0, 0.6283] and an end point at [0.0, 0.1217]. Now, scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.6283. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the coordinates from the coordinate system and the euler angles and translation vector specified. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model, with an extrusion depth towards the normal of 0.0608 and no extrusion depth in the opposite direction of the normal. Part 2: Construct a set of nine cylindrical objects Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 degrees and the translation vector to 0.0304, 0.0, 0.0304. Next, create the 2D sketches for each of the three faces in the coordinate system. On each face, create a loop consisting of a circle with a center at [0.0912, 0.0912] and a radius of 0.0912. Now, scale each of the 2D sketches using a scaling parameter of 0.6891. Transform the scaled 2D sketches into 3D sketches using the coordinates from the coordinate system and the euler angles and translation vector specified. Extrude the 2D sketches to generate the 3D model, with no extrusion depth towards the normal and an extrusion depth in the opposite direction of the normal of 0.2433. This will cut the material from the previous CAD model. The final CAD model should be a rectangular metal bracket with three holes, two on the top and one on the bottom. The length of the final shape is 0.6891, the width is 0.2433, and the height is 0.6891.</description>
